items.title: DataDescriptionType
items.description: The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description in an external system,   e.g. MES.

MaterialStorageLocationID.description: Unique identifier for the location where the material is   produced/stored.

Quantity.description: The quantity of the sublot in the base unit of measure defined in the   MaterialDefinition.

CarrierID.description: The ID of the carrier holding the sublot, for example the bobbin core   fitted with an RFID. If the sublot is not contained in any carrier, then   the CarrierID is NULL.

RelativePositionID.description: The unique identifier of the relative position of the sublot in the   carrier identified by CarrierID. If CarrierID is NULL, then the string is   empty.

ParentSublotID.description: The parent sublot ID is the unique identifier of the material sublot   that contains the sublot structure in question. If the sublot is not   contained in any sublot, then the ParentSublotID is NULL.

Sublots.description: The material sublots contained in the material sublot in question.

items.description: Stand-in for the infinite remainder of this data structure, which is recursively defined.

ExecuteStateMachineStateNumber.description: The value of the state number attribute for the ExecuteStateMachine of the object containing the   event notifier.

StateMachineStateNumber.description: The value of the state number attribute for the TMCStateMachine of the object containing the   event notifier.

UserMachineName.description: The name of the machine for the user.

ControlModeEnumeration.description: The ControlModeEnumeration contains the PackML modes of operation of a machine.

OTHER.description: This state is used if no other state below applies.

PRODUCTION.description: Primary Mode used for all production activities, All PackML model states will be utilized. The unit/machine executes relevant logic in response to commands which are mainly coming from External Systems, or entered directly by the operator.

MAINTENANCE.description: Used for routine preventive Maintenance or planned maintenance. Shall be utilized to document planned maintenance occurrence and duration. This mode allows authorized personnel to run the unit/machine independent of other systems. This mode would typically be used for fault finding, machine trials, or testing operational improvements. For example: The cleaning of a print head is maintenance.

MANUAL.description: Used for fault diagnosis of unplanned technical intervention.

CHANGE_OVER.description: Used specifically for format or recipe change over, includes “cleaning” operations.

CLEAN.description: Used for Routine Cleaning requirements example: as specified by factory maintenance procedures.

SET_UP.description: Used for set up or adjustments example: mechanical adjustments and testing.

EMPTY_OUT.description: Used to empty out machine example: end of a block of shifts prior to factory weekend shut down, empty out resident product within the machine that could be sent to finished product and minimize part finished “rework”.

REMOTE_SERVICE.description: Used when the machine is serviced remotely, which is a form of remote maintenance. Remark. The Remote Service mode fulfil the safety requirements of the harmonized norm EN415-10:2011 (Safety of packaging machines).

ConnectedMaterialPoint.description: The identifier for the node id of the connected material point.

PropagatesProductionOrder.description: The material point propagates the production order with the ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialLoadingPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point receives a production order from the upstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialOutputPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialRejectionPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. This variable is defined by the end user and entered by the developer of the TMC server invoking the SetNewSpecification method.

MES_ID.description: The unique identifier for the material sublot in higher level systems.

MaterialLot.description: The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA   95 Material Lot.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material lot in the underlying system.

MES_ID.description: The unique identifier for the material lot in higher level systems. In some   production contexts the material lot is called a batch.

MaterialDefinition.title: MaterialDefinitionType
MaterialDefinition.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with   ISA 95 Material Definition.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition in an external system, e.g.   MES.

BaseUnitOfMeasure.title: EUInformation
BaseUnitOfMeasure.description: The base unit of measure for the material definition.

BatchManaged.description: If BatchManaged is True, the material lots of this material definition   require a unique identification, often called BatchID. The material lots are   also called batches in some contexts.

GroupID.description: The material group the material definition belongs to.

ParentGroupID.description: The parent group of the material group the material definition belongs to.

ShelfLife.description: The number of days of usable life for the material definition. The usable   life is counted from the production date.

Properties.description: An array containing additional properties that can be additionally   required for the material definition.

Quantity.description: The quantity of the sublot in the base unit of measure defined in the   MaterialDefinition.

CarrierID.description: The ID of the carrier holding the sublot, for example the bobbin core   fitted with an RFID. If the sublot is not contained in any carrier, then   the CarrierID is NULL.

RelativePositionID.description: The unique identifier of the relative position of the sublot in the   carrier identified by CarrierID. If CarrierID is NULL, then the string is   empty.

Starting.description: The state of the machine module is starting.

FormFactor.description: The form factor of the carrier e.g., trolley, AGV, core, IBC, etc.

items.title: MaterialSublotType
items.description: The MaterialSublotType structure contains the material sublot information. It is harmonised with   ISA 95 Material Sublot.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material sublot in the underlying system.

MES_ID.description: The unique identifier for the material sublot in higher level systems.

MaterialLot.title: MaterialLotType
MaterialLot.description: The MaterialLotType structure contains the material lot information. It is harmonised with ISA   95 Material Lot.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material lot in the underlying system.

MES_ID.description: The unique identifier for the material lot in higher level systems. In some   production contexts the material lot is called a batch.

MaterialDefinition.title: MaterialDefinitionType
MaterialDefinition.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with   ISA 95 Material Definition.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition in an external system, e.g.   MES.

BaseUnitOfMeasure.title: EUInformation
BaseUnitOfMeasure.description: The base unit of measure for the material definition.

BatchManaged.description: If BatchManaged is True, the material lots of this material definition   require a unique identification, often called BatchID. The material lots are   also called batches in some contexts.

GroupID.description: The material group the material definition belongs to.

ParentGroupID.description: The parent group of the material group the material definition belongs to.

ShelfLife.description: The number of days of usable life for the material definition. The usable   life is counted from the production date.

Properties.description: An array containing additional properties that can be additionally   required for the material definition.

items.title: DataDescriptionType
items.description: The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description in an external system,   e.g. MES.

Status.title: MaterialStockStatusEnumeration
Status.description: The stock status of the material lot.

ProductionDate.description: The date and time when the material lot was produced.

BestUsedBeforeDate.description: The last date the material lot can be used. It is computed adding the   material definition shelf life to the production date.

Properties.description: An array containing additional properties that can be additionally required   for the material lot.

items.title: DataDescriptionType
items.description: The DataDescriptionType structure contains a metadata, i.e. a description.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the metadata description in an external system,   e.g. MES.

MaterialStorageLocationID.description: Unique identifier for the location where the material is   produced/stored.

Quantity.description: The quantity of the sublot in the base unit of measure defined in the   MaterialDefinition.

CarrierID.description: The ID of the carrier holding the sublot, for example the bobbin core   fitted with an RFID. If the sublot is not contained in any carrier, then   the CarrierID is NULL.

RelativePositionID.description: The unique identifier of the relative position of the sublot in the   carrier identified by CarrierID. If CarrierID is NULL, then the string is   empty.

ParentSublotID.description: The parent sublot ID is the unique identifier of the material sublot   that contains the sublot structure in question. If the sublot is not   contained in any sublot, then the ParentSublotID is NULL.

Sublots.description: The material sublots contained in the material sublot in question.

ControlModeEnumeration.description: The ControlModeEnumeration contains the PackML modes of operation of a machine.

OTHER.description: This state is used if no other state below applies.

PRODUCTION.description: Primary Mode used for all production activities, All PackML model states will be utilized. The unit/machine executes relevant logic in response to commands which are mainly coming from External Systems, or entered directly by the operator.

MAINTENANCE.description: Used for routine preventive Maintenance or planned maintenance. Shall be utilized to document planned maintenance occurrence and duration. This mode allows authorized personnel to run the unit/machine independent of other systems. This mode would typically be used for fault finding, machine trials, or testing operational improvements. For example: The cleaning of a print head is maintenance.

MANUAL.description: Used for fault diagnosis of unplanned technical intervention.

CHANGE_OVER.description: Used specifically for format or recipe change over, includes “cleaning” operations.

CLEAN.description: Used for Routine Cleaning requirements example: as specified by factory maintenance procedures.

SET_UP.description: Used for set up or adjustments example: mechanical adjustments and testing.

EMPTY_OUT.description: Used to empty out machine example: end of a block of shifts prior to factory weekend shut down, empty out resident product within the machine that could be sent to finished product and minimize part finished “rework”.

REMOTE_SERVICE.description: Used when the machine is serviced remotely, which is a form of remote maintenance. Remark. The Remote Service mode fulfil the safety requirements of the harmonized norm EN415-10:2011 (Safety of packaging machines).

Stopped.description: The state of the machine module is stopped.

Resetting.description: The state of the machine module is resetting.

Idle.description: The state of the machine module is idle.

Starting.description: The state of the machine module is starting.

Execute.description: The state of the machine module is execute.

Completing.description: The state of the machine module is completing.

Complete.description: The state of the machine module is complete.

Aborting.description: The state of the machine module is aborting.

Aborted.description: The state of the machine module is aborted.

Stopping.description: The state of the machine module is stopping.

Clearing.description: The state of the machine module is clearing.

Suspending.description: The state of the machine module is suspending.

Suspended.description: The state of the machine module is suspended.

Unsuspending.description: The state of the machine module is unsuspending.

Holding.description: The state of the machine module is holding.

Held.description: The state of the machine module is held.

Unholding.description: The state of the machine module is unholding.

DetectionCountMasterTotal.description: The total number of times the defect reason occurred. The total is never reset to zero.

DetectionCountTotal.description: The total number of times a defect reason occurred. The total is reset to zero only when the   ResetProductionTotals method in the MachineModuleProductionType is executed successfully.

DetectionMode.description: When DetectionMode is True, the defect reason is triggered. When DetectionMode is False, the   defect reason is not active, i.e. never triggered.

The total number of times a defect reason occurred. The total is reset to zero only when the   ResetProductionTotals method in the MachineModuleProductionType is executed successfully.

ParameterDependencyEnumeration.description: The ParameterDependencyEnumeration contains what a parameter is depending upon.

Machine.description: The parameter depends solely from the machine and does not vary with the brand.

Brand.description: The parameter depends solely from the brand being produced and does not vary with the machine.

Machine_and_Brand.description: The parameter depends both from the machine and the brand being produced.

GetDataSetList.description: The GetDatasetList Method returns the list of descriptions for parameters of the dataset filtered   by the dependency and subset created by the user.

Dependency.title: ParameterDependencyEnumeration
Dependency.description: Dependency specifies how to select (filter) a subset of the dataset based on dependency.

UserSubset.description: UserSubset specifies how to select (filter) a subset of the dataset based on the user-defined UserSubset.

CompleteSet.description: If CompleteSet is True, then the method returns the complete dataset without considering the input   parameters Dependency and UserSubset.

DataType.description: Describes the data type of the data point, e.g. FLOAT, INT, STRING,   etc.

UserSubset.description: Used by the user to identify a subset of the dataset that is of   interest.

AlarmRange.title: Range
AlarmRange.description: Outside this range, the underlying system generates an alarm for the   parameter.

DataType.description: Describes the data type of the data point, e.g. FLOAT, INT, STRING,   etc.

UserSubset.description: Used by the user to identify a subset of the dataset that is of   interest.

ControlRange.title: Range
ControlRange.description: The range where the parameter actual values is considered in   control.

AlarmRange.title: Range
AlarmRange.description: Outside this range, the underlying system generates an alarm for the   parameter.

LastChangeDate.description: The Property LastChangeDate is the date and time of the last change applied to the machine   module configuration and the effective date of the modification.

LongestMicroStopDuration.description: The Property LongestMicroStopDuration is the maximum duration of a micro-stop in seconds,   longer stops are not micro-stops. Operators are not required to enter a root cause for micro-stops.

RootCauseGroupList.description: The Property RootCauseGroupList is the list of groups that root causes can be grouped in.   They are defined by the end user.

items.title: RootCauseGroupType
items.description: The RootCauseGroupType structure contains a root cause message and its group identifier.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the root cause group.

ParentID.description: The ID of the group containing the root cause group identified by Id. By   means of the ParentID, multiple nested groups are allowed.

Description.description: The human-readable description of the root cause group identified by   the unique identifier.

RootCauseList.description: The Property RootCauseList is the complete list of the root causes that the end user has defined   to classify and organize the downtime due to the machine module stops. The RootCauseList is   user defined.

items.title: RootCauseMessageType
items.description: The RootCauseMessageType structure contains a root cause message and its group identifier.

GroupID.description: GroupID identifies uniquely each group of root causes which are   grouped in families, e.g. electrical, mechanical, controls, etc.

RootCauseListInputIsMandatory.description: The Property RootCauseListInputIsMandatory is true when the operator is mandatorily required   to select the root cause that best describes the current stop situation. For micro- stops such   requirement does not apply.

StopReasonList.description: The Property StopReasonList is a list containing the descriptors for all the possible machine   module messages, including alarms and warnings. Messages include their localization. The list is   defined, created and maintained by the OEM.

ValidUntil.description: The ValidUntil Propertyontains the date and time the MachineModuleSpecification was last   valid.

NonMixingByBatch.description: The material storage buffer containing a material accepts other materials with the same MaterialLot.

items.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with   ISA 95 Material Definition.

ConnectedMaterialPoint.description: The identifier for the node id of the connected material point.

PropagatesProductionOrder.description: The material point propagates the production order with the ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialLoadingPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point receives a production order from the upstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialOutputPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialRejectionPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. This variable is defined by the end user and entered by the developer of the TMC server invoking the SetNewSpecification method.

UserMachineName.description: The Property UserMachineName of type String contains the name used by the user to identify   the machine module. LocationName and UserMachineName uniquely identify the machine   module in the user organization.

ValidSince.description: The Property ValidSince is the date since the configuration was last modified.

ControlModeEnumeration.description: The ControlModeEnumeration contains the PackML modes of operation of a machine.

OTHER.description: This state is used if no other state below applies.

PRODUCTION.description: Primary Mode used for all production activities, All PackML model states will be utilized. The unit/machine executes relevant logic in response to commands which are mainly coming from External Systems, or entered directly by the operator.

MAINTENANCE.description: Used for routine preventive Maintenance or planned maintenance. Shall be utilized to document planned maintenance occurrence and duration. This mode allows authorized personnel to run the unit/machine independent of other systems. This mode would typically be used for fault finding, machine trials, or testing operational improvements. For example: The cleaning of a print head is maintenance.

MANUAL.description: Used for fault diagnosis of unplanned technical intervention.

CHANGE_OVER.description: Used specifically for format or recipe change over, includes “cleaning” operations.

CLEAN.description: Used for Routine Cleaning requirements example: as specified by factory maintenance procedures.

SET_UP.description: Used for set up or adjustments example: mechanical adjustments and testing.

EMPTY_OUT.description: Used to empty out machine example: end of a block of shifts prior to factory weekend shut down, empty out resident product within the machine that could be sent to finished product and minimize part finished “rework”.

REMOTE_SERVICE.description: Used when the machine is serviced remotely, which is a form of remote maintenance. Remark. The Remote Service mode fulfil the safety requirements of the harmonized norm EN415-10:2011 (Safety of packaging machines).

StateEnumeration.description: The StateEnumeration contains the PackML states for a machine.

Stopped.description: The state of the machine module is stopped.

Resetting.description: The state of the machine module is resetting.

Idle.description: The state of the machine module is idle.

Starting.description: The state of the machine module is starting.

Execute.description: The state of the machine module is execute.

Completing.description: The state of the machine module is completing.

Complete.description: The state of the machine module is complete.

Aborting.description: The state of the machine module is aborting.

Aborted.description: The state of the machine module is aborted.

Stopping.description: The state of the machine module is stopping.

Clearing.description: The state of the machine module is clearing.

Suspending.description: The state of the machine module is suspending.

Suspended.description: The state of the machine module is suspended.

Unsuspending.description: The state of the machine module is unsuspending.

Holding.description: The state of the machine module is holding.

Held.description: The state of the machine module is held.

Unholding.description: The state of the machine module is unholding.

AcknowledgeAlarms.description: The AcknowledgeAlarms Method acknowledges all alarms of the machine module.

MaterialStockStatusEnumeration.description: The MaterialStockStatusEnumeration provides the stock status for a material lot.

Unrestricted.description: The parameter depends solely from the machine and does not vary with the brand.

QualityInspection.description: The parameter depends solely from the brand being produced and does not vary with the machine.

Blocked.description: The parameter depends both from the machine and the brand being produced.

StateEnumeration.description: The StateEnumeration contains the PackML states for a machine.

Stopped.description: The state of the machine module is stopped.

Resetting.description: The state of the machine module is resetting.

Idle.description: The state of the machine module is idle.

Starting.description: The state of the machine module is starting.

Execute.description: The state of the machine module is execute.

Completing.description: The state of the machine module is completing.

Complete.description: The state of the machine module is complete.

Aborting.description: The state of the machine module is aborting.

Aborted.description: The state of the machine module is aborted.

Stopping.description: The state of the machine module is stopping.

Clearing.description: The state of the machine module is clearing.

Suspending.description: The state of the machine module is suspending.

Suspended.description: The state of the machine module is suspended.

Unsuspending.description: The state of the machine module is unsuspending.

Holding.description: The state of the machine module is holding.

Held.description: The state of the machine module is held.

Unholding.description: The state of the machine module is unholding.

CanReceive.description: When True, material sublots or carriers can be stored in the material location. It is set by the underlying   system to make the material location available for receiving.

CanSend.description: When True, material sublots or carriers can be removed in the material location. It is set by the underlying   system to make the material location available for sending.

ID.description: The unique identifier for the material location.

MES_ID.description: The unique identifier of the material location according to a higher-level system, e.g. MES or ERP.

State.title: StateEnumeration
State.description: The state the material location is in.

Min.description: The minimum valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset.  It is only reset by the successful execution of the ResetAggregates method.

Std.description: The standard deviation of the valid value for the last AggregationWindow samples and after the last reset.

Value.description: Value represents the current value measured by the sensor.

OperatorControl.description: The OperatorControl variable qualifies the source of the ProcessControlItem Value when RemoteControl is False, otherwise OperatorControl is undefined. When OperatorControl is True, the underlying system exposes the information that the ProcessControlItem Value is modified by the operator with respect to the nominal value, e.g. NominalRate, a.k.a. design speed for a speed control loop. When OperatorControl is False, the underlying system exposes the information that the ProcessControlItem Value is not modified by the operator.

RemoteControl.description: The RemoteControl variable lets the underlying system expose which system is currently in control of the ProcessControlItem. More specifically, if RemoteControl is True, the underlying system copies the RemoteValue to the ProcesControlItem Value to drive it, i.e. the ProcessControlItem is remotely controlled. If RemoteControl is False, the underlying system is not using RemoteValue to drive the ProcessControlItem, but another value that is exposed as the ProcessControlItem Value, i.e. the ProcessControlItem is locally controlled.  A client requests (resp. releases) control of the ProcessControlItem by setting RemoteControl to True (resp. False) preferably by invoking the SetRemoteControl Method. If the client does not support methods, then the client sets RemoteControl to True. The underlying system will reset RemoteControl to False if remote control is not activated.

RemoteControlEnable.description: The RemoteControlEnable variable exposes when the underlying system is ready to activate the RemoteControl upon a request by a client. When RemoteControlEnable is False, the underlying system is not ready and will not activate a request to remotely control the ProcessControlItem.

RemoteValue.description: The value set by the client to override the object value.

data.description: The value set by the client to override the object value.

PropagatesProductionOrder.description: The material point propagates the production order with the ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialLoadingPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point receives a production order from the upstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialOutputPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. If the material point is a MaterialRejectionPointType, and PropagatesProductionOrder is True, then the material point sends a production order to the downstream ConnectedMaterialPoint. This variable is defined by the end user and entered by the developer of the TMC server invoking the SetNewSpecification method.

When WatchdogEnable is False, no watchdog alarm is generated.

CarrierID.description: The ID of the carrier holding the sublot, for example the bobbin core   fitted with an RFID. If the sublot is not contained in any carrier, then   the CarrierID is NULL.

RelativePositionID.description: The unique identifier of the relative position of the sublot in the   carrier identified by CarrierID. If CarrierID is NULL, then the string is   empty.

ParentSublotID.description: The parent sublot ID is the unique identifier of the material sublot   that contains the sublot structure in question. If the sublot is not   contained in any sublot, then the ParentSublotID is NULL.

Sublots.description: The material sublots contained in the material sublot in question.

ReleaseProductionOrder.description: The ReleaseProductionOrder Method is used to make a production order available to a machine module   for orchestrated execution in a production line (Process Cell according to ANSI/ISA-88.00.01-2010   Physical Model).

POToRelease.description: The OrchestrationProductionOrderType structure contains the complete production order   information used by the Production Order Orchestration Layer.

ProducedMaterial.description: The MaterialDefinitionType structure contains the definition of a material. It is harmonised with   ISA 95 Material Definition.

ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition.

MES_ID.description: Unique identifier for the material definition in an external system, e.g.   MES.

BaseUnitOfMeasure.title: EUInformation
BaseUnitOfMeasure.description: The base unit of measure for the material definition.

BatchManaged.description: If BatchManaged is True, the material lots of this material definition   require a unique identification, often called BatchID. The material lots are   also called batches in some contexts.

GroupID.description: The material group the material definition belongs to.

ParentGroupID.description: The parent group of the material group the material definition belongs to.

ShelfLife.description: The number of days of usable life for the material definition. The usable   life is counted from the production date.

Properties.description: An array containing additional properties that can be additionally   required for the material definition.

TargetStartTime.description: The planned start date and time.

TargetEndTime.description: The planned end date and time.

MaterialListDescription.description: The description of the material list.

MachineModuleUserName.description: The user name of the machine module where the PO is started.

SourceMaterialLoadingPointIDs.description: The MaterialLoadingPoints where input materials will be fed for the Production Order to be   started.

DestinationMaterialOutputPointIDs.description: The MaterialOutputPointss where output materials will be directed to for the Production Order to be started.
